StringProperty.Name: OutputFile
StringProperty.Description: The /OUT option overrides the default name and location of the program that the linker creates.

EnumValue.Name: NotSet
EnumValue.Description: No verbosity.

EnumValue.Name: LinkVerbose
EnumValue.Description: Displays all progress messages.

EnumValue.Name: LinkVerboseLib
EnumValue.Description: Displays progress messages indicating just the libraries searched.

StringProperty.Name: Version
StringProperty.Description: The /VERSION option tells the linker to put a version number in the header of the .exe or .dll file. Use DUMPBIN /HEADERS to see the image version field of the OPTIONAL HEADER VALUES to see the effect of /VERSION.

BoolProperty.Name: LinkIncremental
BoolProperty.Description: Enables incremental linking. (/INCREMENTAL, /INCREMENTAL:NO)

BoolProperty.Name: SuppressStartupBanner
BoolProperty.Description: The /NOLOGO option prevents display of the copyright message and version number.

BoolProperty.Name: IgnoreImportLibrary
BoolProperty.Description: Specifies that the import library generated by this configuration should not be imported into dependent projects.

BoolProperty.Name: RegisterOutput
BoolProperty.Description: Specifies whether to register the primary output of this build.

BoolProperty.Name: PerUserRedirection
BoolProperty.Description: When Register Output is enabled, Per-user redirection forces registry writes to HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT to be redirected to HKEY_CURRENT_USER.

StringListProperty.Name: AdditionalLibraryDirectories
StringListProperty.Description: Allows the user to override the environmental library path. (/LIBPATH:folder)

BoolProperty.Name: LinkLibraryDependencies
BoolProperty.Description: Specifies whether or not library outputs from project dependencies are automatically linked in.

BoolProperty.Name: UseLibraryDependencyInputs
BoolProperty.Description: Specifies whether or not the inputs to the librarian tool are used rather than the library file itself when linking in library outputs of project dependencies.

BoolProperty.Name: LinkStatus
BoolProperty.Description: Specifies whether the linker should display a progress indicator showing what percentage of the link is complete. The default is to not display this status information. (/LTCG:STATUS|LTCG:NOSTATUS)

BoolProperty.Name: PreventDllBinding
BoolProperty.Description: /ALLOWBIND:NO sets a bit in a DLL's header that indicates to Bind.exe that the image is not allowed to be bound. You may not want a DLL to be bound if it has been digitally signed (binding invalidates the signature).

EnumProperty.Name: ForceFileOutput
EnumProperty.Description: The /FORCE option tells the linker to create an .exe file or DLL even if a symbol is referenced but not defined or is multiply defined. It may create invalid exe file.

EnumValue.Name: Enabled
EnumValue.Description: /FORCE with no arguments implies both multiple and unresolved.

EnumValue.Name: MultiplyDefinedSymbolOnly
EnumValue.Description: Use /FORCE:MULTIPLE to create an output file whether or not LINK finds more than one definition for a symbol.

EnumValue.Name: UndefinedSymbolOnly
EnumValue.Description: Use /FORCE:UNRESOLVED to create an output file whether or not LINK finds an undefined symbol. /FORCE:UNRESOLVED is ignored if the entry point symbol is unresolved.

StringProperty.Name: SpecifySectionAttributes
StringProperty.Description: The /SECTION option changes the attributes of a section, overriding the attributes set when the .obj file for the section was compiled.

StringProperty.Name: MSDOSStubFileName
StringProperty.Description: The /STUB option attaches an MS-DOS stub program to a Win32 program.

StringProperty.Name: TrackerLogDirectory
StringProperty.Description: Tracker log directory.

StringListProperty.Name: AdditionalDependencies
StringListProperty.Description: Specifies additional items to add to the link command line. [i.e. kernel32.lib]

BoolProperty.Name: IgnoreAllDefaultLibraries
BoolProperty.Description: The /NODEFAULTLIB option tells the linker to remove one or more default libraries from the list of libraries it searches when resolving external references.

StringListProperty.Name: IgnoreSpecificDefaultLibraries
StringListProperty.Description: Specifies one or more names of default libraries to ignore; separate multiple libraries with semi-colons. (/NODEFAULTLIB:[name, name, ...])

StringProperty.Name: ModuleDefinitionFile
StringProperty.Description: The /DEF option passes a module-definition file (.def) to the linker. Only one .def file can be specified to LINK.

StringListProperty.Name: AddModuleNamesToAssembly
StringListProperty.Description: The /ASSEMBLYMODULE option allows you to add a module reference to an assembly. Type information in the module will not be available to the assembly program that added the module reference. However, type information in the module will be available to any program that references the assembly.

StringListProperty.Name: EmbedManagedResourceFile
StringListProperty.Description: /ASSEMBLYRESOURCE embeds a resource file in the output file.

StringListProperty.Name: ForceSymbolReferences
StringListProperty.Description: The /INCLUDE option tells the linker to add a specified symbol to the symbol table.

StringListProperty.Name: DelayLoadDLLs
StringListProperty.Description: The /DELAYLOAD option causes delayed loading of DLLs. The dllname specifies a DLL to delay load.

BoolProperty.Name: GenerateDebugInformation
BoolProperty.Description: The /DEBUG option creates debugging information for the .exe file or DLL.

StringProperty.Name: ProgramDatabaseFile
StringProperty.Description: By default, when /DEBUG is specified, the linker creates a program database (PDB) which holds debugging information. The default file name for the PDB has the base name of the program and the extension .pdb.

StringProperty.Name: StripPrivateSymbols
StringProperty.Description: The /PDBSTRIPPED option creates a second program database (PDB) file when you build your program image with any of the compiler or linker options that generate a PDB file (/DEBUG, /Z7, /Zd, or /Zi).

BoolProperty.Name: GenerateMapFile
BoolProperty.Description: The /MAP option tells the linker to create a mapfile.

StringProperty.Name: MapFileName
StringProperty.Description: A user-specified name for the mapfile. It replaces the default name.

BoolProperty.Name: MapExports
BoolProperty.Description: The /MAPINFO option tells the linker to include the specified information in a mapfile, which is created if you specify the /MAP option. EXPORTS tells the linker to include exported functions.

EnumProperty.Name: SubSystem
EnumProperty.Description: The /SUBSYSTEM option tells the operating system how to run the .exe file.The choice of subsystem affects the entry point symbol (or entry point function) that the linker will choose.

EnumValue.Name: NotSet
EnumValue.Description: No subsystem set.

EnumValue.Name: Console
EnumValue.Description: Win32 character-mode application. Console applications are given a console by the operating system. If main or wmain is defined, CONSOLE is the default.

EnumValue.Name: Windows
EnumValue.Description: Application does not require a console, probably because it creates its own windows for interaction with the user. If WinMain or wWinMain is defined, WINDOWS is the default.

EnumValue.Name: Native
EnumValue.Description: Device drivers for Windows NT. If /DRIVER:WDM is specified, NATIVE is the default.

EnumValue.Name: EFI Application
EnumValue.Description: EFI Application.

EnumValue.Name: EFI Boot Service Driver
EnumValue.Description: EFI Boot Service Driver.

EnumValue.Name: EFI ROM
EnumValue.Description: EFI ROM.

EnumValue.Name: EFI Runtime
EnumValue.Description: EFI Runtime.

EnumValue.Name: WindowsCE
EnumValue.Description: Application that runs on a Windows CE device.

EnumValue.Name: POSIX
EnumValue.Description: Application that runs with the POSIX subsystem in Windows NT.

StringProperty.Name: MinimumRequiredVersion
StringProperty.Description: Specify the minimum required version of the subsystem. The arguments are decimal numbers in the range 0 through 65,535.

StringProperty.Name: HeapReserveSize
StringProperty.Description: Specifies total heap allocation size in virtual memory. Default is 1MB. (/HEAP:reserve)

StringProperty.Name: HeapCommitSize
StringProperty.Description: Specifies total heap allocation size in physical memory. Default is 4KB. (/HEAP:reserve,commit)

StringProperty.Name: StackReserveSize
StringProperty.Description: Specifies the total stack allocation size in virtual memory. Default is 1MB. (/STACK:reserve)

StringProperty.Name: StackCommitSize
StringProperty.Description: Specifies the total stack allocation size in physical memory. Default is 4KB. (/STACK:reserve,commit)

BoolProperty.Name: LargeAddressAware
BoolProperty.Description: The /LARGEADDRESSAWARE option tells the linker that the application can handle addresses larger than 2 gigabytes. By default, /LARGEADDRESSAWARE:NO is enabled if /LARGEADDRESSAWARE is not otherwise specified on the linker line.

BoolProperty.Name: TerminalServerAware
BoolProperty.Description: The /TSAWARE option sets a flag in the IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER DllCharacteristics field in the program image's optional header. When this flag is set, Terminal Server will not make certain changes to the application.

BoolProperty.Name: SwapRunFromCD
BoolProperty.Description: The /SWAPRUN option tells the operating system to first copy the linker output to a swap file, and then run the image from there. This is a Windows NT 4.0 (and later) feature.When CD is specified, the operating system will copy the image on a removable disk to a page file and then load it.

BoolProperty.Name: SwapRunFromNET
BoolProperty.Description: The /SWAPRUN option tells the operating system to first copy the linker output to a swap file, and then run the image from there. This is a Windows NT 4.0 (and later) feature. If NET is specified, the operating system will first copy the binary image from the network to a swap file and load it from there. This option is useful for running applications over the network.

EnumProperty.Name: Driver
EnumProperty.Description: Use the /DRIVER linker option to build a Windows NT kernel mode driver.

EnumValue.Name: NotSet
EnumValue.Description: Default driver setting.

EnumValue.Name: UpOnly
EnumValue.Description: /DRIVER:UPONLY causes the linker to add the IMAGE_FILE_UP_SYSTEM_ONLY bit to the characteristics in the output header to specify that it is a uniprocessor (UP) driver. The operating system will refuse to load a UP driver on a multiprocessor (MP) system.

EnumValue.Name: WDM
EnumValue.Description: /DRIVER:WDM causes the linker to set the IMAGE_DLLCHARACTERISTICS_WDM_DRIVER bit in the optional header's DllCharacteristics field.

BoolProperty.Name: OptimizeReferences
BoolProperty.Description: /OPT:REF eliminates functions and/or data that are never referenced while /OPT:NOREF keeps functions and/or data that are never referenced.

BoolProperty.Name: OptimizeWin98
BoolProperty.Description: Align code on 4K boundaries. This improves performance on Windows 98 systems. (/OPT:WIN98, /OPT:NOWIN98)

BoolProperty.Name: EnableCOMDATFolding
BoolProperty.Description: Use /OPT:ICF[=iterations] to perform identical COMDAT folding.

StringProperty.Name: FunctionOrder
StringProperty.Description: The /ORDER option tells LINK to optimize your program by placing certain COMDATs into the image in a predetermined order. LINK places the functions in the specified order within each section in the image.

EnumValue.Name: Default
EnumValue.Description: Default LTCG setting.

EnumValue.Name: UseLinkTimeCodeGeneration
EnumValue.Description: Use Link Time Code Generation.

StringProperty.Name: MidlCommandFile
StringProperty.Description: Specify MIDL command line Options. (/MIDL:@responsefile)

BoolProperty.Name: IgnoreEmbeddedIDL
BoolProperty.Description: The /IGNOREIDL option specifies that any IDL attributes in source code should not be processed into an .idl file.

StringProperty.Name: MergedIDLBaseFileName
StringProperty.Description: The /IDLOUT option specifies the name and extension of the .idl file.

StringProperty.Name: TypeLibraryFile
StringProperty.Description: The /TLBOUT option specifies the name and extension of the .tlb file.

IntProperty.Name: TypeLibraryResourceID
IntProperty.Description: Allows you to specify the resource ID of the linker-generated type library. (/TLBID:id)

StringProperty.Name: EntryPointSymbol
StringProperty.Description: The /ENTRY option specifies an entry point function as the starting address for an .exe file or DLL.

BoolProperty.Name: NoEntryPoint
BoolProperty.Description: The /NOENTRY option is required for creating a resource-only DLL.Use this option to prevent LINK from linking a reference to _main into the DLL.

BoolProperty.Name: SetChecksum
BoolProperty.Description: The /RELEASE option sets the Checksum in the header of an .exe file.

StringProperty.Name: BaseAddress
StringProperty.Description: Sets a base address for the program. (/BASE:{address[,size] | @filename,key})

BoolProperty.Name: FixedBaseAddress
BoolProperty.Description: Creates a program that can be loaded only at its preferred base address. (/FIXED[:NO])

BoolProperty.Name: TurnOffAssemblyGeneration
BoolProperty.Description: The /NOASSEMBLY option tells the linker to create an image for the current output file without a .NET Framework assembly.

BoolProperty.Name: SupportUnloadOfDelayLoadedDLL
BoolProperty.Description: The UNLOAD qualifier tells the delay-load helper function to support explicit unloading of the DLL. (/DELAY:UNLOAD)

BoolProperty.Name: SupportNobindOfDelayLoadedDLL
BoolProperty.Description: The NOBIND qualifier tells the linker not to include a bindable IAT in the final image. The default is to create the bindable IAT for delay-loaded DLLs. (/DELAY:NOBIND)

StringProperty.Name: ImportLibrary
StringProperty.Description: Overrides the default import library name. (/IMPLIB:filename)

StringProperty.Name: MergeSections
StringProperty.Description: The /MERGE option combines the first section (from) with the second section (to), naming the resulting section to. For example, /merge:.rdata=.text.

EnumProperty.Name: TargetMachine
EnumProperty.Description: The /MACHINE option specifies the target platform for the program.

IntProperty.Name: SectionAlignment
IntProperty.Description: The /ALIGN option specifies the alignment of each section within the linear address space of the program. The number argument is in bytes and must be a power of two.

StringProperty.Name: AdditionalOptions
StringProperty.Description: Additional Options.
